articles.author: Leika Kihara
articles.description: Japanese wholesale inflation slowed below 1% for the first time in just over 2-1/2-years, data showed on Monday, a sign that cost push pressures that had been driving up prices for a wide range of goods were starting to fade.
articles.title: Japan's wholesale inflation slows sharply in sign of waning cost pressures

articles.author: Jayshree Pyasi, Ira Dugal
articles.description: A sudden explosive growth in stock options trading in India this year has got the country's retail traders excited and regulators worried about the risks such speculative fervour could spawn.
articles.title: Excitement and worry as stock options trading booms in India

articles.author: Yuka Obayashi
articles.description: Oil prices eased on Monday, reversing their rally on Friday, as renewed concerns over waning demand in the United States and China dented market sentiment.
articles.title: Oil prices ease on worries of waning demand in US and China

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Global ratings agency Fitch said on Monday it plans to withdraw all the ratings on China's Country Garden Services Holding (6098.HK) on or about Dec. 12 for commercial reasons.
articles.title: Fitch plans to withdraw ratings of Country Garden Services

articles.author: Tim Hepher, Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: Middle East carriers look set to order tens of billions of dollars of long-haul jets at the opening of the Dubai Airshow on Monday, as Emirates renews confidence in the delayed Boeing 777X while facing new competition from rivals like Turkish Airlines.
articles.title: Looming Emirates 777X deal to kickstart Dubai Airshow, sources say

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Ernest Scheyder
articles.description: The United States and Indonesia on Monday will discuss how to advance a potential minerals partnership aimed a stimulating trade of the electric vehicle (EV) battery metal nickel, according to three people with direct knowledge of the conversations.
articles.title: Exclusive: US, Indonesia to discuss potential for deal on EV minerals

articles.author: Heekyong Yang
articles.description: Hyundai Motor Co (005380.KS) on Monday broke ground on a 2 trillion won ($1.52 billion) dedicated electric vehicle (EV) plant in South Korea, as the automaker accelerate a shift to electrification.
articles.title: Hyundai Motor breaks ground on $1.5 billion EV plant in South Korea

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dan Williams
articles.description: The largest hospital in Gaza has ceased to function and fatalities among patients are rising, the head of the World Health Organization (WHO) said on Sunday, as a blistering Israeli assault continues in the Hamas-controlled strip.
articles.title: Gaza's largest hospital 'not functioning' amid Israeli assault

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy warned Ukrainians on Sunday to prepare for new waves of Russian attacks on infrastructure as winter approached and said troops were anticipating an onslaught in the eastern theatre of the war.
articles.title: Zelenskiy tells Ukrainians to prepare for Russian winter onslaught

articles.author: Don Durfee, Kevin Yao, Eduardo Baptista
articles.description: China's leaders, determined to upgrade manufacturing, are steering money toward makers of high-tech products, from semiconductors to EVs, raising fears that overcapacity will fuel a new wave of cheap exports.
articles.title: China's high-tech manufacturing loans raise fears of wave of cheap exports
